snippet: To restart military aid, the Obama administration plans on sidestepping a new Congressional requirement that links assistance to the protection of basic freedoms.
abstract: Obama administration plans to resume military aid to Egypt, signaling its willingness to remain deeply engaged with the generals running the country despite concerns over human rights abuses and a still-uncertain transition to democracy.
lead_paragraph: To restart military aid, the Obama administration plans on sidestepping a new Congressional requirement that links assistance to the protection of basic freedoms.

headline.seo: U.S. Military Aid to Egypt to Resume, Officials Say
headline.main: Despite Rights Concerns, U.S. Plans to Resume Egypt Aid
headline.print_headline: U.S. Plans to Resume Military Aid to Egypt, Despite Human Rights Concerns

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
